assistant_response: Probably.  I mean, that’s really a question for statistics, so I’ll tell you what I think the facts are. That means the country has probably added around 3 percent of its population by people who were born in Mexico.  On the other hand, that’s about one third the percentage of immigration from Mexico in the United States over the past 20 years.  So even if the rate of Mexican immigration doesn’t go up much in the future, you can still expect the percentage of the population of the United States that was born in Mexico to grow by a lot over the next 20 years.
